item.title: Phyllis add a quote by John Waters
item.description: "Being rich is not about how much money you have or how many homes you own; it's the freedom to buy any book you want without looking at the price and wondering if you can afford it." -- John Waters

item.title: Phyllis add a quote by Helene Hanff
item.description: "I do love secondhand books that open to the page some previous owner read oftenest. The day Hazlitt came he opened to "I hate to read new books," and I hollered "Comrade!" to whoever owned it before me." -- Helene Hanff

item.title: Phyllis add a quote by Diana Vreeland
item.description: "Too much good taste can be boring" -- Diana Vreeland

item.title: Phyllis add a quote by Yohji Yamamoto
item.description:
"Fashion sighs after trends. I want timeless elegance.
Fashion has no time. I do. I say: Hello Lady, how can I help you?
Fashion has no time to even ask such a question, because it is constantly concerned with finding out: What will come next?
It is more about helping women to suffer less, to attain more freedom and independence." -- Yohji Yamamoto
